comment.author: 92943860@N00
comment._content: Should be clearing of rock drilling. The men working are in white Prison uniforms are under armed guard. They are convict labour on enforced work. The Public Works Department (PWD) routinely used convict labour on civil construction projects. Here is a job vacancy for a Works Superintendant (Prisons Department) for construction projects in Tanganyika in 1952 (advertised in the Kenya Gazette): books.google.co.uk/books?id=o-vlvjb7dTkC&pg=PA1308&am...

comment.author: 92943860@N00
comment._content: This might be Kidachi which is north of Iringa and south of Dodoma
